main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in Phoenix, Arizona in 1952, including various shapes like cigar-shaped and disc-shaped objects, with reports of extremely high speeds and maneuverability.
interesting points: Sightings included an elliptical-shaped object moving at a speed of about 40,000 MPH observed by pilots of the 78th Fighter Interceptor Squadron.
A pilot flying at 33,000 feet reported a mysterious luminous object traveling in the same direction and altitude as his aircraft, which then appeared to pull away from him.
Approximately 200-300 feet in diameter brilliant object was observed by several persons, traveling at an estimated speed of 600-700 miles per hour.
Competent observers at Phoenix airport witnessed small disc-shaped objects maneuvering silently, far exceeding the performance capabilities of any known type of aircraft.
A cigar-shaped object, about five times as long as its diameter, was observed hovering over downtown Phoenix, exhibiting speeds of 500-600 miles per hour and extreme maneuverability.
sighted object: multiple unidentified flying objects of various shapes
witnesses: multiple witnesses including pilots, business people, and civilians
photographs: none of the reports include photographs
